title: Superball

children.value:
A basketball of mass 
$\vari{m_1}$
 and radius 
$\vari{r_1}$
 and a tennis ball of mass 
$\vari{m_2}$
 and radius 
$\vari{r_2}$
 are held with the bottom of the tennis ball touching the top of the basketball, and the bottom of the basketball is a height 
$\vari{h}$
 above the ground. The balls are then dropped together.

answer.value:
The tennis ball bounces up a height 
$\valuedef{\Delta H}{9h}{}$
, and so the final height of the centre of mass will be given by 
$\valuedef{H}{9h + 2r_1 + r_2}{}$
.

children.value: What is the maximum height that the centre of mass the tennis ball reaches after the balls bounce off the floor?
